reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports: midterm report by 3 August 2021 and final report by 28 January 2022; Panel of Experts reports to the Council by 6 September 2021 and 25 February 2022
summary:
The Security Council, recalling previous relevant resolutions, 
1. Decides to extend until 30 April 2022 the mandate of the Panel of Experts, as specified in paragraph 26 of resolution 1874 (2009) and modified in paragraph 29 of resolution 2094 (2013), and applies this mandate to measures imposed in resolutions 2270 (2016), 2321 (2016), 2356 (2017), 2371 (2017), 2375 (2017), and 2397 (2017), and reviews the mandate by 25 March 2022.
2. Requests the Panel to provide a midterm report to the Committee by 3 August 2021 and to the Council by 6 September 2021, and a final report to the Committee by 28 January 2022 and to the Council by 25 February 2022.
3. Requests the Panel to provide a planned programme of work within thirty days of reappointment and to update the Committee on any changes.
4. Underscores that the Panel shall conduct credible, fact-based, independent assessments.
5. Expresses intent to follow the Panel's work.
6. Urges States, UN bodies, and parties to cooperate fully with the Committee and Panel.
7. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
